s3games.engine

Class GameSpecification

  • java.lang.Object
    • s3games.engine.GameSpecification

  • public class GameSpecification
extends java.lang.Object
    The GameSpecification contains all information loaded from the game specification file. It is all the information that is needed to now how to play and visualize a specific game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.lang.String boardBackgroundFileName
      path to a file that contains an image for the game window background
      java.util.ArrayList<CameraObjectType> cameraObjectTypes
      lists specifications of objects to be detected by the camera when playing on real-world game board

      list of elements indexed through their name
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ElementType> elementTypes
      list of element types indexed through their name

      list of all expressions.

      name of the game

      initial scores for all players

      list of locations indexed through their name

      list of location types indexed through their name
      java.lang.String[] playerNames
      names of players - just for visualization
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GameRule> rules
      lists all the game rules, indexed by their name
      java.util.ArrayList<GameScoring> scorings
      specifies how the players scores change if particular game states are reached
      java.util.Map<Expr,Expr> terminationConditions
      list of conditions expressions that determine the game is over, if they evaluate to true.

    • Field Detail

      • gameName

        public java.lang.String gameName
        name of the game

      • boardBackgroundFileName

        public java.lang.String boardBackgroundFileName
        path to a file that contains an image for the game window background

      • locationTypes

      • elementTypes

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,ElementType> elementTypes
        list of element types indexed through their name

      • elements

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Element> elements
        list of elements indexed through their name

      • locations

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Location> locations
        list of locations indexed through their name

      • expressions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Expression> expressions
        list of all expressions. expressions are user "functions" that can be evaluated in current context to get any value. they are used in many different places in game rules, and can have names. This list contains named expressions and is indexed through the names of the expressions

      • terminationConditions

        public java.util.Map<Expr,Expr> terminationConditions
        list of conditions expressions that determine the game is over, if they evaluate to true. the map contains conditions as keys, and player numbers that win the game in that case as values

      • scorings

        public java.util.ArrayList<GameScoring> scorings
        specifies how the players scores change if particular game states are reached

      • rules

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,GameRule> rules
        lists all the game rules, indexed by their name

      • cameraObjectTypes

        public java.util.ArrayList<CameraObjectType> cameraObjectTypes
        lists specifications of objects to be detected by the camera when playing on real-world game board

      • playerNames

        public java.lang.String[] playerNames
        names of players - just for visualization

      • initialPlayerScore

        public int initialPlayerScore
        initial scores for all players

    • Method Detail

      • load

        public boolean load(java.lang.String gameName)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        load game specification from a file
        Parameters:
        the - name of game - and the file where the specification is loaded from (in games/ folder)
        Returns:
        true, if the game specification was successfully parsed and loaded
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • findClosestCameraLocation

        public Location findClosestCameraLocation(int x,
                                 int y)
        find a camera location which is closest to a specified pixel
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of the pixel
        y - y-coordinate of the pixel
        Returns:
        a location object that is closest to the specified pixel of the camera image
